replies.bodyText:
This method no longer exists, as I needed to use the other one (purgeResource()).
But in either case a record is added to the transaction_operations table for the purge and then those changes are committed to the actual resource table inside a database transaction as part of the commit()
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: It is probably a small enough issue that it doesn't merit worrying about too much, but, in purgeResource, it is technically possible for the rollback of a delete to be applied but the purge not be applied. In that case, the transaction_operations table is in an incorrect state and it doesn't matter that it's committed to the resources table in a transaction.
replies.author: pwinckles
